docker.containers.groupBy.description: The property to use to group containers in Docker view: ContainerId, ContainerName, CreatedTime, FullTag, ImageId, Networks, Ports, Registry, Repository, RepositoryName, RepositoryNameAndTag, State, Status, Tag, or None

docker.containers.description.description: Any secondary properties to display for a container (an array). Possible elements include: ContainerId, ContainerName, CreatedTime, FullTag, ImageId, Networks, Ports, Registry, Repository, RepositoryName, RepositoryNameAndTag, State, Status, and Tag

docker.containers.label.description: The primary property to display for a container: ContainerId, ContainerName, CreatedTime, FullTag, ImageId, Networks, Ports, Registry, Repository, RepositoryName, RepositoryNameAndTag, State, Status, or Tag

docker.containers.sortBy.description: The property to use to sort containers in Docker view: CreatedTime or Label

docker.contexts.description.description: Any secondary properties to display for a Docker context (an array). Possible elements include: Name, Description and DockerEndpoint

docker.contexts.label.description: The primary property to display for a Docker context: Name, Description or DockerEndpoint

docker.images.groupBy.description: The property to use to group images in Docker view: CreatedTime, FullTag, ImageId, None, Registry, Repository, RepositoryName, RepositoryNameAndTag, or Tag

docker.images.description.description: Any secondary properties to display for a image (an array). Possible elements include: CreatedTime, FullTag, ImageId, Registry, Repository, RepositoryName, RepositoryNameAndTag, Tag, and Size

docker.images.label.description: The primary property to display for a image: CreatedTime, FullTag, ImageId, Registry, Repository, RepositoryName, RepositoryNameAndTag, Tag, or Size

docker.images.sortBy.description: The property to use to sort images in Docker view: CreatedTime, Label, or Size

docker.images.checkForOutdatedImages.description: Check for outdated base images once per Visual Studio Code session

docker.networks.groupBy.description: The property to use to group networks in Docker view: CreatedTime, NetworkDriver, NetworkId, NetworkName, or None

docker.networks.description.description: Any secondary properties to display for a Docker network (an array). Possible elements include CreatedTime, NetworkDriver, NetworkId, and NetworkName

docker.networks.showBuiltInNetworks.description: Show the built-in networks in the explorer.

docker.networks.label.description: The primary property to display for a Docker network: CreatedTime, NetworkDriver, NetworkId, or NetworkName

docker.networks.sortBy.description: The property to use to sort networks in Docker view: CreatedTime or Label

docker.volumes.groupBy.description: The property to use to group volumes in Docker view: CreatedTime, VolumeName, or None

docker.volumes.description.description: Any secondary properties to display for a Docker volume (an array). Possible values include CreatedTime and VolumeName

docker.volumes.label.description: The primary property to display for a Docker volume: CreatedTime or VolumeName

docker.volumes.sortBy.description: The property to use to sort volumes in Docker view: CreatedTime or Label

docker.imageBuildContextPath.description: Build context PATH to pass to Docker build command.

docker.truncateLongRegistryPaths.description: Set to true to truncate long image and container registry paths in Docker view

docker.truncateMaxLength.description: Maximum length of a registry paths displayed in Docker view, including ellipsis. The truncateLongRegistryPaths setting must be set to true for truncateMaxLength setting to be effective.

docker.dockerodeOptions.description: If specified, this object will be passed to the Dockerode constructor. Takes precedence over DOCKER_HOST, the Docker Host setting, and any existing Docker contexts.

docker.host.description: Equivalent to setting the DOCKER_HOST environment variable, for example, ssh://myuser@mymachine or tcp://1.2.3.4.

docker.context.description: Equivalent to setting the DOCKER_CONTEXT environment variable.

docker.certPath.description: Equivalent to setting the DOCKER_CERT_PATH environment variable.

docker.tlsVerify.description: Equivalent to setting the DOCKER_TLS_VERIFY environment variable.

docker.machineName.description: Equivalent to setting the DOCKER_MACHINE_NAME environment variable.

docker.languageserver.diagnostics.deprec.description: Controls the diagnostic severity for the deprecated MAINTAINER instruction

docker.languageserver.diagnostics.emptyC.description: Controls the diagnostic severity for flagging empty continuation lines found in instructions that span multiple lines

docker.languageserver.diagnostics.direct.description: Controls the diagnostic severity for parser directives that are not written in lowercase

docker.languageserver.diagnostics.instru.description: Controls the diagnostic severity for instructions that are not written in uppercase
Controls the diagnostic severity for flagging a Dockerfile with multiple CMD instructions
Controls the diagnostic severity for flagging a Dockerfile with multiple ENTRYPOINT instructions
Controls the diagnostic severity for flagging a Dockerfile with multiple HEALTHCHECK instructions
Controls the diagnostic severity for JSON instructions that are written incorrectly with single quotes
Controls the diagnostic severity for WORKDIR instructions that do not point to an absolute path

docker.languageserver.formatter.ignoreMu.description: Controls whether the Dockerfile formatter should ignore instructions that span multiple lines when formatting

docker.dockerComposeBuild.description: Set to true to include --build option when docker-compose command is invoked

docker.dockerComposeDetached.description: Set to true to include --d (detached) option when docker-compose command is invoked

docker.showRemoteWorkspaceWarning.description: Set to true to prompt to switch from "UI" extension mode to "Workspace" extension mode if an operation is not supported in UI mode.

docker.scaffolding.templatePath.description: The path to use for scaffolding templates.

docker.dockerPath.description: Absolute path to Docker client executable ('docker' command). If the path contains whitespace, it needs to be quoted appropriately.

docker.enableDockerComposeLanguageServic.description: Whether or not to enable the preview Docker Compose Language Service. Changing requires restart to take effect.

python.autoComplete.extraPaths.description: List of paths to libraries and the like that need to be imported by auto complete engine. E.g. when using Google App SDK, the paths are not in system path, hence need to be added into this list.

python.condaPath.description: Path to the conda executable to use for activation (version 4.4+).

python.createNewFileEnabled.description: Enable the `Python: New Python File` command.

python.defaultInterpreterPath.description: Path to default Python to use when extension loads up for the first time, no longer used once an interpreter is selected for the workspace. See https://aka.ms/AAfekmf to understand when this is used.

python.experiments.enabled.description: Enables A/B tests experiments in the Python extension. If enabled, you may get included in proposed enhancements and/or features.

python.experiments.optInto.description: List of experiment to opt into. If empty, user is assigned the default experiment groups. See https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-python/wiki/Experiments for more details.

python.experiments.optOutFrom.description: List of experiment to opt out of. If empty, user is assigned the default experiment groups. See https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-python/wiki/Experiments for more details.

python.languageServer.description: Defines type of the language server.

python.linting.prospectorPath.description: Path to Prospector, you can use a custom version of prospector by modifying this setting to include the full path.

python.linting.pydocstylePath.description: Path to pydocstyle, you can use a custom version of pydocstyle by modifying this setting to include the full path.

python.linting.pylintPath.description: Path to Pylint, you can use a custom version of pylint by modifying this setting to include the full path.

python.logging.level.description: The logging level the extension logs at, defaults to 'error'

python.pipenvPath.description: Path to the pipenv executable to use for activation.

python.sortImports.args.description: Arguments passed in. Each argument is a separate item in the array.

python.sortImports.path.description: Path to isort script, default using inner version

python.tensorBoard.logDirectory.description: Set this setting to your preferred TensorBoard log directory to skip log directory prompt when starting TensorBoard.

python.terminal.activateEnvInCurrentTerm.description: Activate Python Environment in the current Terminal on load of the Extension.

python.terminal.activateEnvironment.description: Activate Python Environment in Terminal created using the Extension.

python.terminal.executeInFileDir.description: When executing a file in the terminal, whether to use execute in the file's directory, instead of the current open folder.

python.terminal.launchArgs.description: Python launch arguments to use when executing a file in the terminal.

python.testing.autoTestDiscoverOnSaveEna.description: Enable auto run test discovery when saving a test file.

python.testing.debugPort.description: Port number used for debugging of tests.

python.testing.promptToConfigure.description: Prompt to configure a test framework if potential tests directories are discovered.

python.testing.pytestArgs.description: Arguments passed in. Each argument is a separate item in the array.

python.testing.pytestPath.description: Path to pytest (pytest), you can use a custom version of pytest by modifying this setting to include the full path.

python.testing.unittestArgs.description: Arguments passed in. Each argument is a separate item in the array.

python.venvFolders.description: Folders in your home directory to look into for virtual environments (supports pyenv, direnv and virtualenvwrapper by default).

python.venvPath.description: Path to folder with a list of Virtual Environments (e.g. ~/.pyenv, ~/Envs, ~/.virtualenvs).

enumDescriptions: Do not check for insiders updates.
Automatically check for and install insiders updates daily.

python.analysis.autoSearchPaths.description: Automatically add common search paths like 'src'.

python.analysis.stubPath.description: Path to directory containing custom type stub files.

enumDescriptions: Analyzes and reports errors on only open files.
Analyzes and reports errors on all files in the workspace.

python.analysis.indexing.description: Index installed third party libraries and user files for language features such as auto-import, add import, workspace symbols and etc.

python.analysis.useLibraryCodeForTypes.description: Use library implementations to extract type information when type stub is not present.

python.analysis.typeCheckingMode.description: Defines the default rule set for type checking.
enumDescriptions: Surfaces diagnostics for invalid syntax, unresolved imports, undefined variables.
All "off" rules + basic type checking rules.
All "off" rules + all type checking rules.

python.analysis.diagnosticSeverityOverri.description: Allows a user to override the severity levels for individual diagnostics.

reportGeneralTypeIssues.description: Diagnostics for general type inconsistencies, unsupported operations, argument/parameter mismatches, etc. Covers all of the basic type-checking rules not covered by other rules. Does not include syntax errors.

reportPropertyTypeMismatch.description: Diagnostics for property whose setter and getter have mismatched types.

reportFunctionMemberAccess.description: Diagnostics for member accesses on functions.

reportMissingImports.description: Diagnostics for imports that have no corresponding imported python file or type stub file.

reportMissingModuleSource.description: Diagnostics for imports that have no corresponding source file. This happens when a type stub is found, but the module source file was not found, indicating that the code may fail at runtime when using this execution environment. Type checking will be done using the type stub.

reportMissingTypeStubs.description: Diagnostics for imports that have no corresponding type stub file (either a typeshed file or a custom type stub). The type checker requires type stubs to do its best job at analysis.

reportImportCycles.description: Diagnostics for cyclical import chains. These are not errors in Python, but they do slow down type analysis and often hint at architectural layering issues. Generally, they should be avoided.

reportUnusedImport.description: Diagnostics for an imported symbol that is not referenced within that file.

reportUnusedClass.description: Diagnostics for a class with a private name (starting with an underscore) that is not accessed.

reportUnusedFunction.description: Diagnostics for a function or method with a private name (starting with an underscore) that is not accessed.

reportUnusedVariable.description: Diagnostics for a variable that is not accessed.

reportDuplicateImport.description: Diagnostics for an imported symbol or module that is imported more than once.

reportWildcardImportFromLibrary.description: Diagnostics for an wildcard import from an external library.

reportOptionalSubscript.description: Diagnostics for an attempt to subscript (index) a variable with an Optional type.

reportOptionalMemberAccess.description: Diagnostics for an attempt to access a member of a variable with an Optional type.

reportOptionalCall.description: Diagnostics for an attempt to call a variable with an Optional type.

reportOptionalIterable.description: Diagnostics for an attempt to use an Optional type as an iterable value (e.g. within a for statement).

reportOptionalContextManager.description: Diagnostics for an attempt to use an Optional type as a context manager (as a parameter to a with statement).

reportOptionalOperand.description: Diagnostics for an attempt to use an Optional type as an operand to a binary or unary operator (like '+', '==', 'or', 'not').

reportTypedDictNotRequiredAccess.description: Diagnostics for an attempt to access a non-required key within a TypedDict without a check for its presence.

reportUntypedFunctionDecorator.description: Diagnostics for function decorators that have no type annotations. These obscure the function type, defeating many type analysis features.

reportUntypedClassDecorator.description: Diagnostics for class decorators that have no type annotations. These obscure the class type, defeating many type analysis features.

reportUntypedBaseClass.description: Diagnostics for base classes whose type cannot be determined statically. These obscure the class type, defeating many type analysis features.

reportUntypedNamedTuple.description: Diagnostics when namedtuple is used rather than NamedTuple. The former contains no type information, whereas the latter does.

reportPrivateUsage.description: Diagnostics for incorrect usage of private or protected variables or functions. Protected class members begin with a single underscore _ and can be accessed only by subclasses. Private class members begin with a double underscore but do not end in a double underscore and can be accessed only within the declaring class. Variables and functions declared outside of a class are considered private if their names start with either a single or double underscore, and they cannot be accessed outside of the declaring module.

reportPrivateImportUsage.description: Diagnostics for incorrect usage of symbol imported from a "py.typed" module that is not re-exported from that module.

reportConstantRedefinition.description: Diagnostics for attempts to redefine variables whose names are all-caps with underscores and numerals.

reportIncompatibleMethodOverride.description: Diagnostics for methods that override a method of the same name in a base class in an incompatible manner (wrong number of parameters, incompatible parameter types, or incompatible return type).

reportIncompatibleVariableOverride.description: Diagnostics for overrides in subclasses that redefine a variable in an incompatible way.

reportInconsistentConstructor.description: Diagnostics for __init__ and __new__ methods whose signatures are inconsistent.

reportOverlappingOverload.description: Diagnostics for function overloads that overlap in signature and obscure each other or have incompatible return types.

reportMissingSuperCall.description: Diagnostics for missing call to parent class for inherited `__init__` methods.

reportUninitializedInstanceVariable.description: Diagnostics for instance variables that are not declared or initialized within class body or `__init__` method.

reportInvalidStringEscapeSequence.description: Diagnostics for invalid escape sequences used within string literals. The Python specification indicates that such sequences will generate a syntax error in future versions.

reportUnknownParameterType.description: Diagnostics for input or return parameters for functions or methods that have an unknown type.

reportUnknownArgumentType.description: Diagnostics for call arguments for functions or methods that have an unknown type.

reportUnknownLambdaType.description: Diagnostics for input or return parameters for lambdas that have an unknown type.

reportUnknownVariableType.description: Diagnostics for variables that have an unknown type..

reportUnknownMemberType.description: Diagnostics for class or instance variables that have an unknown type.

reportMissingParameterType.description: Diagnostics for parameters that are missing a type annotation.

reportMissingTypeArgument.description: Diagnostics for generic class reference with missing type arguments.

reportInvalidTypeVarUse.description: Diagnostics for improper use of type variables in a function signature.

reportCallInDefaultInitializer.description: Diagnostics for function calls within a default value initialization expression. Such calls can mask expensive operations that are performed at module initialization time.

reportUnnecessaryIsInstance.description: Diagnostics for 'isinstance' or 'issubclass' calls where the result is statically determined to be always true or always false. Such calls are often indicative of a programming error.

reportUnnecessaryCast.description: Diagnostics for 'cast' calls that are statically determined to be unnecessary. Such calls are sometimes indicative of a programming error.

reportUnnecessaryComparison.description: Diagnostics for '==' and '!=' comparisons that are statically determined to be unnecessary. Such calls are sometimes indicative of a programming error.

reportAssertAlwaysTrue.description: Diagnostics for 'assert' statement that will provably always assert. This can be indicative of a programming error.

reportSelfClsParameterName.description: Diagnostics for a missing or misnamed self parameter in instance methods and cls parameter in class methods. Instance methods in metaclasses (classes that derive from type) are allowed to use cls for instance methods.

reportImplicitStringConcatenation.description: Diagnostics for two or more string literals that follow each other, indicating an implicit concatenation. This is considered a bad practice and often masks bugs such as missing commas.

reportInvalidStubStatement.description: Diagnostics for type stub statements that do not conform to PEP 484.

reportIncompleteStub.description: Diagnostics for the use of a module-level __getattr__ function, indicating that the stub is incomplete.

reportUndefinedVariable.description: Diagnostics for a missing or misnamed self parameter in instance methods and cls parameter in class methods. Instance methods in metaclasses (classes that derive from type) are allowed to use cls for instance methods.

reportUnboundVariable.description: Diagnostics for unbound and possibly unbound variables.

reportUnusedCallResult.description: Diagnostics for call expressions whose results are not consumed and are not None.

reportUnusedCoroutine.description: Diagnostics for call expressions that return a Coroutine and whose results are not consumed.

reportUnsupportedDunderAll.description: Diagnostics for unsupported operations performed on __all__.

reportUnnecessaryTypeIgnoreComment.description: Diagnostics for '# type: ignore' comments that have no effect.

reportMatchNotExhaustive.description: Diagnostics for 'match' statements that do not exhaustively match all possible values.

python.analysis.logLevel.description: Specifies the level of logging for the Output panel

python.analysis.typeshedPaths.description: Paths to look for typeshed modules.

jupyter.showVariableViewWhenDebugging.description: Bring up the Variable View when starting a Run by Line session.

jupyter.logging.level.description: The logging level the extension logs at.

jupyter.experiments.optInto.markdownDescription: List of experiment to opt into. If empty, user is assigned the default experiment groups. [Learn more](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-jupyter/wiki/Experiments).

jupyter.experiments.optOutFrom.markdownDescription: List of experiment to opt out of. If empty, user is assigned the default experiment groups. [Learn more](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-jupyter/wiki/Experiments).

jupyter.enableKeyboardShortcuts.description: Enables Jupyter style keyboard shortcuts for Notebooks.

jupyter.allowImportFromNotebook.description: Allows a user to import a jupyter notebook into a python file anytime one is opened.

enumDescriptions: Loads widget (javascript) scripts from https://www.jsdelivr.com/
Loads widget (javascript) scripts from https://unpkg.com/

jupyter.widgetScriptSources.markdownDescription: Defines the location and order of the sources where scripts files for Widgets are downloaded from (e.g. ipywidgest, bqplot, beakerx, ipyleaflet, etc). Not selecting any of these could result in widgets not rendering or function correctly. See [here](https://aka.ms/PVSCIPyWidgets) for more information. Once updated you will need to restart the Kernel.

jupyter.askForLargeDataFrames.description: Warn the user before trying to open really large data frames.

jupyter.askForKernelRestart.description: Warn the user before restarting a kernel.

jupyter.exportWithOutputEnabled.description: Enable exporting a python file into a jupyter notebook and run all cells when doing so.

jupyter.jupyterLaunchTimeout.description: Amount of time (in ms) to wait for the Jupyter Notebook server to start.

jupyter.jupyterLaunchRetries.description: Number of times to attempt to connect to the Jupyter Notebook

jupyter.jupyterServerType.description: Determines the type of connection for talking to jupyter. Local will start kernels locally. Remote allows for connections to remote servers

jupyter.jupyterCommandLineArguments.description: When a Notebook Editor or Interactive Window Jupyter server is started, these arguments will be passed to it. By default this list is generated by the Jupyter Extension.

jupyter.notebookFileRoot.description: Set the root directory for running notebooks and the Interactive window.

jupyter.searchForJupyter.description: Search all installed Python interpreters for a Jupyter installation when starting the Interactive window

jupyter.changeDirOnImportExport.description: When importing or exporting a Jupyter Notebook add a directory change command to allow relative path loading to work.

jupyter.useDefaultConfigForJupyter.description: When running Jupyter locally, create a default empty Jupyter config for the Interactive window

jupyter.jupyterInterruptTimeout.description: Amount of time (in ms) to wait for an interrupt before asking to restart the Jupyter kernel.

jupyter.allowInput.description: Allow the inputting of python code directly into the Interactive window

jupyter.collapseCellInputCodeByDefault.description: Collapse cell input code by default.
jupyter.collapseCellInputCodeByDefault.markdownDeprecationMessage: This setting has been deprecated, please use `#interactiveWindow.collapseCellInputCode#` instead.

jupyter.maxOutputSize.description: Maximum size (in pixels) of text output in the Notebook Editor before a scrollbar appears. First enable scrolling for cell outputs in settings.

jupyter.alwaysScrollOnNewCell.description: Automatically scroll the interactive window to show the output of the last statement executed. If false, the interactive window will only automatically scroll if the bottom of the prior cell is visible.

jupyter.enableScrollingForCellOutputs.description: Enables scrolling for large cell outputs in the Notebook Editor. This setting does not apply to the Interactive Window.

jupyter.sendSelectionToInteractiveWindow.description: When pressing shift+enter, send selected code in a Python file to the Jupyter interactive window as opposed to the Python terminal.

jupyter.variableExplorerExclude.description: Types to exclude from showing in the Interactive variable explorer

jupyter.codeRegularExpression.description: Regular expression used to identify code cells. All code until the next match is considered part of this cell.

jupyter.defaultCellMarker.description: Cell marker used for delineating a cell in a python file.

jupyter.markdownRegularExpression.description: Regular expression used to identify markdown cells. All comments after this expression are considered part of the markdown.

jupyter.allowLiveShare.description: Allow the Interactive window to be shared during a Live Share session

jupyter.ignoreVscodeTheme.description: Don't use the VS Code theme in the Interactive window (requires reload of VS Code). This forces the Interactive window to use 'Light +(default light)' and disables matplotlib defaults.

jupyter.themeMatplotlibPlots.description: In the Interactive window and Notebook Editor theme matplotlib outputs to match the VS Code editor theme.

jupyter.liveShareConnectionTimeout.description: Amount of time to wait for guest connections to verify they have the Python extension installed.

jupyter.decorateCells.description: Draw a highlight behind the currently active cell.

jupyter.enableCellCodeLens.description: Enables code lens for 'cells' in a python file.

jupyter.enableAutoMoveToNextCell.description: Enables moving to the next cell when clicking on a 'Run Cell' code lens.

jupyter.allowUnauthorizedRemoteConnectio.description: Allow for connecting the Interactive window to a https Jupyter server that does not have valid certificates. This can be a security risk, so only use for known and trusted servers.

jupyter.generateSVGPlots.description: Generate SVG output for notebook plots. This allows for better display in the plot viewer at the cost of generation speed and file size.

jupyter.codeLenses.description: Set of commands to put as code lens above a cell.

jupyter.debugCodeLenses.description: Set of debug commands to put as code lens above a cell while debugging.

jupyter.debugpyDistPath.description: Path to debugpy bits for debugging cells.

jupyter.stopOnFirstLineWhileDebugging.description: When debugging a cell, stop on the first line.

jupyter.remoteDebuggerPort.description: When debugging a cell, open this port on the remote box. If -1 is specified, a random port between 8889 and 9000 will be attempted.

jupyter.disableJupyterAutoStart.description: When true, disables Jupyter from being automatically started for you. You must instead run a cell to start Jupyter.

jupyter.textOutputLimit.description: Limit the amount of text in Interactive cell text output to this value. 0 to allow any amount of characters.

jupyter.colorizeInputBox.description: Whether or not to use the theme's peek color as the background for the input box.

jupyter.stopOnError.description: Stop running cells if a cell throws an exception.

jupyter.addGotoCodeLenses.description: After running a cell, add a 'Goto' code lens on the cell. Note, disabling all code lenses disables this code lens as well.

path.markdownDescription:
Fully qualified path to the kernel spec or the python enviornment. 
E.g. `~/miniconda3/envs/sample/bin/python`.

jupyter.kernels.filter.markdownDescription: List of Jupyter Kernels and/or python environments that are to be excluded from the Kernel picker.

jupyter.interactiveWindowMode.description: Behavior of the Interactive Window. 'perFile' will create a new interactive window for every file that runs a cell. 'single' allows a single window. 'multiple' allows the creation of multiple.

jupyter.magicCommandsAsComments.description: Uncomment shell assignments (#!), line magic (#!%) and cell magic (#!%%) when parsing code cells.

jupyter.pythonExportMethod.description: The method to use when exporting a notebook to a Python file. 'direct' will copy over the code directly as is. 'commentMagics' will comment out lines starting with line magics (%), cell magics (%%), and shell commands(!). 'nbconvert' will install nbconvert and use that for the conversion which can translate iPython syntax into Python syntax.

jupyter.runStartupCommands.description: A series of Python instructions or iPython magic commands. Can be either an array of strings or a single string with commands separated by '\n'. Commands will be silently executed whenever the interactive window loads. For instance, set this to '%load_ext autoreload\n%autoreload 2' to automatically reload changes made to imported files without having to restart the interactive session.

jupyter.debugJustMyCode.description: When debugging, debug just my code.

jupyter.showOutlineButtonInNotebookToolb.description: Show the Outline button in the Jupyter notebook toolbar.

jupyter.newCellOnRunLast.description: Append a new empty cell to an interactive window file on running the currently last cell.

jupyter.pylanceHandlesNotebooks.description: Determines if pylance's experimental notebook support is used or not.

jupyter.pythonCompletionTriggerCharacter.description: Characters which trigger auto completion on a python jupyter kernel.

jupyter.logKernelOutputSeparately.description: Creates separate output panels for kernels/jupyter server console output

remote.containers.defaultExtensions.description: Configures the list of extensions to always install while creating a container.

enumDescriptions: Perfect consistency.
The hosts view is authoritative.
The containers view is authoritative.
remote.containers.workspaceMountConsiste.description: The consistency level used for the workspace mount (existing containers must be rebuilt to take effect).

remote.containers.cacheVolume.description: Controls whether a Docker volume should be used to cache the VS Code server and extensions. Currently only applies to single container and not Docker Compose configurations.

remote.containers.copyGitConfig.markdownDescription: Controls whether the Git configuration (`~/.gitconfig`) should be copied into the container. This is done after installing any `#dotfiles.repository#` and will not overwrite an existing Git configuration file.

enumDescriptions: Write to system config (`/etc/gitconfig`, requires root access).
Write to user config (`~/.gitconfig`).
Do not set a credential helper.
remote.containers.gitCredentialHelperCon.description: Where to write the configuration for the Git credential helper.

remote.containers.logLevel.description: The log level for the extension.

remote.containers.dockerPath.description: Docker (or Podman) executable name or path.

remote.containers.dockerComposePath.description: Docker Compose executable name or path.

remote.containers.executeInWSL.description: Controls whether CLI commands should always be executed in WSL. The default is to only execute in WSL for workspace folders in WSL. This setting has no effect on other platforms than Windows.

remote.containers.executeInWSLDistro.markdownDescription: WSL distro to use when not reopening a WSL folder. The default is to use the default WSL distro (see `wsl -l`). This setting has no effect when `#remote.containers.executeInWSL#` is not enabled or on other platforms than Windows.

dotfiles.repository.description: URL of a dotfiles Git repository (e.g., https://github.com/owner/repository.git) or owner/repository of a GitHub repository.

dotfiles.installCommand.description: The command to run after cloning the dotfiles repository. Defaults to run the first file of `install.sh`, `install`, `bootstrap.sh`, `bootstrap`, `setup.sh` and `setup` found in the dotfiles repository's root folder.

dotfiles.targetPath.description: The path to clone the dotfiles repository to. Defaults to `~/dotfiles`.

remote.containers.dotfiles.repository.description: URL of a dotfiles Git repository (e.g., https://github.com/owner/repository.git) or owner/repository of a GitHub repository for DevContainers. This overrides the common setting for the dotfiles repository.

remote.containers.dotfiles.installComman.description: The command to run after cloning the dotfiles repository for DevContainers. This overrides the common setting for the dotfiles install command.

remote.containers.dotfiles.targetPath.description: The path to clone the dotfiles repository to for DevContainers. This overrides the common setting for the dotfiles target path.

remote.containers.repositoryConfiguratio.markdownDescription: List of additional paths to search for [repository configurations](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-dev-containers/tree/main/repository-containers).

remote.SSH.configFile.description: The absolute file path to a custom SSH config file.

remote.SSH.showLoginTerminal.description: Always reveal the SSH login terminal.

remote.SSH.defaultForwardedPorts.description: A list of ports to forward when the connection is established.

remote.SSH.defaultExtensions.description: List of extensions that should be installed automatically on all SSH hosts.

remote.SSH.path.description: An absolute path to the SSH executable. When empty, it will use "ssh" on the path or in common install locations.

remote.SSH.serverInstallPath.description: A map of remote host to absolute path where the VS Code server will be installed. By default the server is installed in the home directory of every remote. **Note**: By changing this setting you may need to clean up other installations of `.vscode-server` on your remote that isn't in the path you've configured.

remote.SSH.lockfilesInTmp.markdownDescription: Whether to keep lockfiles in `/tmp` instead of in the server's install folder. Useful for connecting to hosts which have issues with locking, such as hosts with a home directory using NFS or another distributed filesystem.

remote.SSH.useFlock.markdownDescription: Whether to use `flock` for creating lockfiles on Linux remotes instead of `ln`. By default, we use `flock` on Linux remotes and `ln` on macOS.

remote.SSH.enableDynamicForwarding.description: Whether to use SSH dynamic forwarding to allow setting up new port tunnels over an existing SSH connection. When this is used, a password only needs to be entered once for each remote window.

remote.SSH.enableAgentForwarding.markdownDescription: Enable fixing the remote environment so that the SSH config option `ForwardAgent` will take effect as expected from VS Code's remote extension host.

remote.SSH.enableX11Forwarding.markdownDescription: Enable fixing the remote environment so that the SSH config option `ForwardX11` will take effect as expected from VS Code's remote extension host.

remote.SSH.enableRemoteCommand.markdownDescription: **Experimental:** Enable using RemoteCommands from ssh config entries. This is only enabled if `remote.ssh.useLocalServer` is enabled as well.

remote.SSH.allowLocalServerDownload.description: If downloading the VS Code server fails on the host, this allows the extension to fall back to downloading on the client and transferring it to the host with scp.

remote.SSH.localServerDownload.description: Whether the extension can download the VS Code Server on the client and transfer it to the host with scp, instead of downloading it on the host.
enumDescriptions: The server will first be downloaded on the host, and if that fails, will fall back to downloading locally
The server will only be downloaded locally and transferred to the host
The server will only be downloaded on the host

remote.SSH.windowsRemotes.markdownDescription: **Deprecated**: Enables experimental support for connecting to Windows remotes. Add the names of windows remotes to this list.

remote.SSH.useLocalServer.markdownDescription: Enables a mode for connecting using a single connection shared between windows and across window reloads. This makes it faster to open new windows and reduces the number of times a password needs to be entered.

remote.SSH.connectTimeout.description: Specifies the timeout in seconds used for the SSH command that connects to the remote.

remote.SSH.logLevel.description: The log level for the extension.

remote.SSH.maxReconnectionAttempts.markdownDescription: The maximum number of times to attempt reconnection. Use 0 to disallow reconnection, and `null` to use the maximum of 8.

remote.SSH.suppressWindowsSshWarning.description: Due to a bug with password handling in some versions of the SSH client bundled with Windows, the extension prefers a non-Windows SSH client, such as the one bundled with Git, and will show a warning when another one can't be found. This setting disables that warning.

remote.SSH.remotePlatform.markdownDescription: A map of the remote hostname to the platform for that remote. Valid values: `linux`, `macOS`, `windows`. Note - this setting will soon be required when useLocalServer is disabled, so it is currently being autopopulated for successful connections, but is not currently used.

remote.SSH.remoteServerListenOnSocket.markdownDescription: When true, the remote VS Code server will listen on a socket path instead of opening a port. Only valid for Linux and macOS remotes. After toggling this setting, run the command "Kill VS Code Server on Host..." for it to take effect. Requires OpenSSH 6.7+. Disables the "local server" connection multiplexing mode. Requires `AllowStreamLocalForwarding` to be enabled for the SSH server.

remote.SSH.foldersSortOrder.description: Specifies the order in which to display folders under SSH Targets in the Remote Explorer.

remote.SSH.serverPickPortsFromRange.markdownDescription: A map of the remote hostname to a range of ports you'd prefer the server to connect to on launch on the remote machine. If no free port is found in range, an error will be thrown. Valid ranges of the form `number-number` such as `4000-5000`; it's expected the first number will be lower than the next.

remote.WSL.fileWatcher.polling.description: If set, polling is used for file watching inside WSL1. Polling can be CPU intensive but fixes the WSL1 issue that folders can not be renamed when watched. This option requires restart to take effect.

remote.WSL.fileWatcher.pollingInterval.description:
The file watcher polling interval in ms used inside WSL1 distros if `remote.WSL.fileWatcher.polling` is set.
This option requires restart to take effect.

remote.WSL.debug.description: If set, the output in the WSL log shows debug information.

remote.WSL.useShellEnvironment.description: If set, the WSL windows gets the environment from the shell it was opened from.

remote.WSL.server.connectThroughLocalhos.description: If set, the connection to a VS Code server running in WSL2 will use localhost (::1). If not set, the connection will directly use the WSL2 VM's IP addresss if accessible or localhost if not.

enumDescriptions: Connects to the server in WSL though 127.0.0.1 which is beeing shared between Windows and WSL1.
Connects to the server in WSL through a local proxy server that uses 'wsl.exe' to forward the connection to WSL.
remote.WSL1.connectionMethod.description: Specifies how Remote - WSL will connect to the VS Code server running in WSL1 distros. This option requires restart to take effect.

enumDescriptions: Connects to the server in WSL though localhost (::1) which is forwarded to the WSL2 VM by Windows.
Connects to the server in WSL though the IP address of the WSL2 VM.
Connects to the server in WSL through a local proxy server that uses 'wsl.exe' to forward the connection to WSL.
remote.WSL2.connectionMethod.description: Specifies how Remote - WSL will connect to the VS Code server running in WSL2 distros. This option requires restart to take effect.

hexeditor.inspectorType.description: Where the data inspector should be shown in the hex editor.

hexeditor.maxFileSize.description: The max file size (in MB) that the editor will try to open before warning you.

hexeditor.dataInspector.autoReveal.description: Whether to auto reveal the data inspector when the hex editor is opened.

hexeditor.defaultEndianness.description: The endianness selected when loading the editor.

hexeditor.columnWidth.description: The number of bytes per row to show in the editor.

hexeditor.showDecodedText.description: Whether decoded text should be shown in the editor.

livePreview.portNumber.description: Which local port the live preview's server should try initially. If this port number doesn't work, it will increment the port number until it finds a free port.

livePreview.serverKeepAliveAfterEmbedded.description: How many minutes after closing the embedded preview you want the server to shut off. Set to 0 to have server stay on indefinetely.

livePreview.showStatusBarItem.description: Whether to show the current hosting port when server is open on the status bar.

livePreview.showServerStatusNotification.description: Whether or not to show information messages on server on/off status change.

livePreview.autoRefreshPreview.description: How often to automatically refresh the preview.

livePreview.tasks.browserPreviewLaunchSe.description: Whether the auto-generated task terminal has logging.

livePreview.notifyOnOpenLooseFile.description: Whether to notify the user when opening a preview for a file that is not part of the currently opened workspace (or the workspace where the server is hosted).

livePreview.tasks.runTaskWithExternalPre.description: Whether or not to pair external preview instances with the auto-generated server task. When disabled, the server will also not automatically close (until the window is closed).

livePreview.defaultPreviewPath.description: The file to automatically show upon starting the server. Leave blank to open at the index.

livePreview.debugOnExternalPreview.description: Whether or not to attach the JavaScript debugger on external preview launches.

livePreview.hostIP.description: The local IP host address to host your files on.

liveshare.anonymousGuestApproval.description: Controls how to handle join requests from anonymous guests.

liveshare.launcherClient.description: Specifies the client to launch when clicking on a Live Share URL.

liveshare.diagnosticLoggingLevel.description: Specifies the level of logging output from Visual Studio Live Share Extension

liveshare.diagnosticLogging.description: Enables the Visual Studio Live Share output channel.

liveshare.connectionMode.description: Type of connection used for collaboration; the default (auto) mode prefers a direct connection, but may fallback to a cloud relay if the direct connection failed.

liveshare.nameTagVisibility.description: Controls when to display a participant's name tag instead of just their cursor.

liveshare.guestApprovalRequired.description: Controls whether the host needs to explicitly approve guest requests to join collaboration sessions.

liveshare.shareExternalFiles.description: Automatically share external files opened by the host during a collaboration session.

liveshare.joinDebugSessionOption.description: Controls how the participant will join incoming shared debug sessions.

liveshare.showInStatusBar.description: Show or hide the Live Share status bar items.

liveshare.sharedTerminalWidth.description: Width of shared terminal window, characters.

liveshare.sharedTerminalHeight.description: Height of shared terminal window, characters.

liveshare.featureSet.markdownDescription: Controls set of active features. By selecting `insiders`, you agree to the [Pre-Release Software License Terms](https://aka.ms/vsls-license-preview) and [Privacy Statement](https://aka.ms/vsls-privacy).

liveshare.keepAliveInterval.description: Sets the number of seconds to wait before sending keep-alive messages in an idle session, used to detect abnormal network disconnection. Set to -1 to disable sending keep-alive messages.

liveshare.allowGuestTaskControl.description: Allow guests to run and terminate workspace tasks.

liveshare.allowGuestDebugControl.description: Allow guests to start and stop debugging sessions.

liveshare.languages.allowGuestCommandCon.description: Allow guests to run arbitrary commands via Code Actions (Quick Fixes) and CodeLens

liveshare.notebooks.allowGuestExecuteCel.description: Allow guests to run notebook cells

liveshare.focusBehavior.description: Specifies how to respond to focus requests from other participants.

liveshare.alwaysFollowHost.description: Ensures that the session's host is always followed.

liveshare.showReadOnlyUsersInEditor.description: Controls visibility of the cursor and highlights for read-only users.

liveshare.increasedGuestLimit.description: Increases the guest limit from 5 to 30.

liveshare.autoShareTerminals.description: Controls whether terminals are automatically shared with guests (read-only).

liveshare.codeLens.description: Controls whether to show the CodeLens for starting a collaboration session.

liveshare.showVerboseNotifications.description: Controls whether to show verbose notifications, such as when a guest joins and leaves a session.

liveshare.populateGitCoAuthors.description: Specifies when to automatically populate your Git commit message with guest attribution (using the Git-co-author trailer).

liveshare.autoShareServers.description: Controls whether web servers are automatically shared, when started from the integrated terminal or well-known extensions.

liveshare.openSharedServers.description: Controls whether to automatically open shared servers in your default browser.

liveshare.presence.description: Controls whether to publish your presence to other users, and allow in-tool invites for collaboration sessions

liveshare.publishWorkspaceInfo.description: Controls whether to publish your current workspace folder to other users

liveshare.comments.description: Controls whether to allow comments in collaboration sessions

liveshare.allowInvites.description: Specifies who to allow session invitations from.

liveshare.accessibility.accessibilityFea.description: Enables various accessibility features, such as audio cues about what is happening in the session.

liveshare.accessibility.outputDevice.description: Output device to play audio in accessibility mode.

liveshare.accessibility.voiceVolume.description: Controls the volume of voice audio in accessibility mode (between 0 and 100).

liveshare.accessibility.soundVolume.description: Controls the volume of sound audio in accessibility mode (between 0 and 100).

liveshare.accessibility.speechRate.description: Controls the rate of speech in accessibility mode.

liveshare.accessibility.voice.description: The voice used for speech in accessibility mode.

material-icon-theme.showWelcomeMessage.description: Show the welcome message after first installation.

material-icon-theme.showUpdateMessage.description: Show the update message after each update.

material-icon-theme.activeIconPack.description: Select an icon pack that enables specific icons.
enumDescriptions: Icons for Angular.
Icons for Angular and ngrx.
Icons for React.
Icons for React and Redux.
Icons for Vue.
Icons for Vue and Vuex.
Icons for NestJS.
No icon pack enabled.

material-icon-theme.folders.theme.description: Set the type for the folder icons.
enumDescriptions: Select specific folder icons.
Select classic folder icons.
No folder icons.

material-icon-theme.folders.color.description: Change the color of the folder icons.

material-icon-theme.opacity.description: Change the opacity of the icons.

material-icon-theme.saturation.description: Change the saturation of the icons.

prisma.fileWatcher.description: Enable/disable the File Watcher functionality for Prisma Client.

prisma.trace.server.description: Setting for logging between the VS Code extension and the language server.

quicktype.justTypes.description: Produce just types, or (de-)serialization code as well?

quicktype.inferMaps.description: Infer maps when object keys look like map keys.

quicktype.inferEnums.description: Infer enums when there aren't many different string values.

quicktype.inferDateTimes.description: Use date-time types for strings that look like date-times.

quicktype.inferUuids.description: Use UUID types for strings that look like UUIDs.

quicktype.inferIntegerStrings.description: Convert stringified integers into integers, and back.

quicktype.inferBooleanStrings.description: Convert stringified booleans into booleans, and back.

ruby.locate.description: Defines where the Ruby extension will look to find Modules, Classes and methods.

include.description: glob pattern to select files to parse. Matches are performed against the path relative to the workspace root

exclude.description: glob pattern to select files to ignore, this is also run against paths for exclusion from walking. Matches are performed against the path relative to the workspace root

ruby.interpreter.commandPath.description: Path to the Ruby interpreter.  Set this to an absolute path to select from multiple installed Ruby versions.

logLevel.description: Set the language server's log level

ruby.codeCompletion.description: Method to use for code completion. Use `false` to disable or if another extension provides this feature.

ruby.intellisense.description: Method to use for intellisense (go to definition, etc.). Use `false` to disable or if another extension provides this feature.

ruby.useBundler.description: Whether ruby tools should be started using Bundler

ruby.pathToBundler.description: Path to the bundler executable (used if useBundler is true)

ruby.rctComplete.commandPath.description: Path to the rct-complete command.  Set this to an absolute path to select from multiple installed Ruby versions.

ruby.lintDebounceTime.description: Time (ms) to wait after keypress before running enabled linters. Ensures linters are only run when typing has finished and not for every keypress. Not supported in language server

ruby.lint.description: Set individual ruby linters to use

command.description: reek command. Setting this will cause reek to be executed exactly this way and other settings will be ignored!
RuboCop command. Setting this will cause RuboCop to be executed this way and other settings will be ignored!

lint.description: Enable Lint cops: Lint cops check for possible errors and very bad practices in your code. RuboCop implements in a portable way all built-in MRI lint checks (ruby -wc) and adds a lot of extra lint checks of its own.

only.description: Run only the specified cop(s) and/or cops in the specified departments

except.description: Run all cops enabled by configuration except the specified cop(s) and/or departments

rails.description: Rails cops are specific to the Ruby on Rails framework. These cops require the rubocop-rails gem for RuboCop >= 0.72.0

command.description: Standard command. Setting this will cause standard to be executed this way and other settings will be ignored!

only.description: Run only the specified cop(s) and/or cops in the specified departments

except.description: Run all cops enabled by configuration except the specified cop(s) and/or departments

ruby.format.description: Which system to use for formatting. Use `false` to disable or if another extension provides this feature.

fileutils.typeahead.enabled.description: Controls if directory selector should be shown.

svelte.enable-ts-plugin.title: Enable TypeScript Svelte plugin
svelte.enable-ts-plugin.description: Enables a TypeScript plugin which provides intellisense for Svelte files inside TS/JS files.

svelte.ask-to-enable-ts-plugin.title: Ask to enable TypeScript Svelte plugin
svelte.ask-to-enable-ts-plugin.description: Ask on startup to enable the TypeScript plugin.

svelte.language-server.runtime.title: Language Server Runtime
svelte.language-server.runtime.description: - You normally don't need this - Path to the node executable to use to spawn the language server. This is useful when you depend on native modules such as node-sass as without this they will run in the context of vscode, meaning node version mismatch is likely. Minimum required node version is 12.17. This setting can only be changed in user settings for security reasons.

svelte.language-server.ls-path.title: Language Server Path
svelte.language-server.ls-path.description: - You normally don't set this - Path to the language server executable. If you installed the "svelte-language-server" npm package, it's within there at "bin/server.js". Path can be either relative to your workspace root or absolute. Set this only if you want to use a custom version of the language server. This will then also use the workspace version of TypeScript. This setting can only be changed in user settings for security reasons.

svelte.language-server.port.title: Language Server Port
svelte.language-server.port.description: - You normally don't set this - At which port to spawn the language server. Can be used for attaching to the process for debugging / profiling. If you experience crashes due to "port already in use", try setting the port. -1 = default port is used.

svelte.trace.server.description: Traces the communication between VS Code and the Svelte Language Server.

svelte.plugin.typescript.definitions.ena.title: TypeScript: Go to Definition
svelte.plugin.typescript.definitions.ena.description: Enable go to definition for TypeScript

svelte.plugin.typescript.signatureHelp.e.title: TypeScript: Signature Help
svelte.plugin.typescript.signatureHelp.e.description: Enable signature help (parameter hints) for TypeScript

svelte.plugin.typescript.rename.enable.title: TypeScript: Rename
svelte.plugin.typescript.rename.enable.description: Enable rename functionality for JS/TS variables inside Svelte files

svelte.plugin.typescript.semanticTokens..title: TypeScript: Semantic Tokens
svelte.plugin.typescript.semanticTokens..description: Enable semantic tokens (semantic highlight) for TypeScript.

svelte.plugin.typescript.implementation..title: Typescript: Go to Implementation
svelte.plugin.typescript.implementation..description: Enable go to implementation for Typescript

svelte.plugin.typescript.typeDefinition..title: Typescript: Go to Type Definition
svelte.plugin.typescript.typeDefinition..description: Enable go to Type Definition for Typescript

svelte.plugin.css.globals.title: CSS: Global Files
svelte.plugin.css.globals.description: Which css files should be checked for global variables (`--global-var: value;`). These variables are added to the css completions. String of comma-separated file paths or globs relative to workspace root.

svelte.plugin.css.completions.emmet.title: CSS: Include Emmet Completions
svelte.plugin.css.completions.emmet.description: Enable emmet auto completions for CSS

svelte.plugin.html.completions.emmet.title: HTML: Include Emmet Completions
svelte.plugin.html.completions.emmet.description: Enable emmet auto completions for HTML

svelte.plugin.html.renameTags.enable.title: HTML: Rename tags
svelte.plugin.html.renameTags.enable.description: Enable rename for the opening/closing tag pairs in HTML

svelte.plugin.svelte.useNewTransformatio.title: Use a new transformation for intellisense
svelte.plugin.svelte.useNewTransformatio.description: Svelte files need to be transformed to something that TypeScript understands for intellisense. Version 2.0 of this transformation can be enabled with this setting. It will be the default, soon.

svelte.plugin.svelte.compilerWarnings.title: Svelte: Compiler Warnings Settings
svelte.plugin.svelte.compilerWarnings.description: Svelte compiler warning codes to ignore or to treat as errors. Example: { 'css-unused-selector': 'ignore', 'unused-export-let': 'error'}

svelte.plugin.svelte.format.enable.title: Svelte: Format
svelte.plugin.svelte.format.enable.description: Enable formatting for Svelte (includes css & js). You can set some formatting options through this extension. They will be ignored if there's any kind of configuration file, for example a `.prettierrc` file.

svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.svelt.title: Svelte Format: Sort Order
svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.svelt.description: Format: join the keys `options`, `scripts`, `markup`, `styles` with a - in the order you want. This option is ignored if there's any kind of configuration file, for example a `.prettierrc` file.

svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.svelt.title: Svelte Format: Strict Mode
svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.svelt.description: More strict HTML syntax. This option is ignored if there's any kind of configuration file, for example a `.prettierrc` file.

svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.svelt.title: Svelte Format: Allow Shorthand
svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.svelt.description: Option to enable/disable component attribute shorthand if attribute name and expression are the same. This option is ignored if there's any kind of configuration file, for example a `.prettierrc` file.

svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.svelt.title: Svelte Format: Bracket New Line
svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.svelt.description: Put the `>` of a multiline element on a new line. This option is ignored if there's any kind of configuration file, for example a `.prettierrc` file.

svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.svelt.title: Svelte Format: Indent Script And Style
svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.svelt.description: Whether or not to indent code inside `<script>` and `<style>` tags. This option is ignored if there's any kind of configuration file, for example a `.prettierrc` file.

svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.print.title: Svelte Format: Print Width
svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.print.description: Maximum line width after which code is tried to be broken up. This is a Prettier core option. If you have the Prettier extension installed, this option is ignored and the corresponding option of that extension is used instead. This option is also ignored if there's any kind of configuration file, for example a `.prettierrc` file.

svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.singl.title: Svelte Format: Quotes
svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.singl.description: Use single quotes instead of double quotes, where possible. This is a Prettier core option. If you have the Prettier extension installed, this option is ignored and the corresponding option of that extension is used instead. This option is also ignored if there's any kind of configuration file, for example a `.prettierrc` file.

svelte.plugin.svelte.defaultScriptLangua.title: Svelte: Default Script Language
svelte.plugin.svelte.defaultScriptLangua.description: The default language to use when generating new script tags

VSCodeCounter.useGitignore.description: Whether to use '.gitignore' files for excluding files.

VSCodeCounter.useFilesExclude.description: Whether to use setting 'files.exclude' for excluding files.

VSCodeCounter.maxOpenFiles.description: Maximum number of files that VSCodeCounter can read simultaneously.

VSCodeCounter.printNumberWithCommas.description: Whether to print a number with commas as thousands separators.(except for CSV)

VSCodeCounter.endOfLine.description: A new line character to be used in the output file.

VSCodeCounter.include.description: Configure glob patterns for including files and folders.

VSCodeCounter.exclude.description: Configure glob patterns for excluding files and folders.

VSCodeCounter.history.description: Controls the number of recent result to keep in history. If it is greater than 1, save the results in separate directories.

VSCodeCounter.outputAsText.description: Whether to output the result as a text file.

VSCodeCounter.outputAsCSV.description: Whether to output the result as a CSV file.

VSCodeCounter.outputAsMarkdown.description: Whether to output the result as a Markdown file.

VSCodeCounter.outputPreviewType.description: Type of output file to preview after counting.

VSCodeCounter.saveLocation.description: Specify where to store the collected language configurations.

extensions.description: File extensions associated to the language.

lineComments.description: The character sequence that starts a line comment.

blockComments.description: The character sequence indicating the beginning and end of the block comment.

blockStrings.description: The character sequence indicating the beginning and end of the block document(here document).

errorLens.enabled.description: Controls all decorations and features (except commands).

errorLens.fontWeight.markdownDescription: Font weight of inline message. `"normal"` is alias for 400, `"bold"` is alias for 700).

errorLens.fontStyleItalic.description: When enabled - shows inline message in italic font style.

errorLens.fontSize.description: Font size of inline message (CSS units).

errorLens.margin.description: Distance between the last word on the line and the start of inline message (CSS units).

errorLens.padding.markdownDescription: Padding of the message. Visible difference when `message` colors are set. [issues/23](https://github.com/usernamehw/vscode-error-lens/issues/23). Example: `2px 1ch`.

errorLens.borderRadius.markdownDescription: Border radius of the message. Visible difference when `message` colors are set. [issues/23](https://github.com/usernamehw/vscode-error-lens/issues/23). Example: `5px`.

errorLens.enabledDiagnosticLevels.description: Customize which diagnostic levels to highlight.

errorLens.messageTemplate.markdownDescription:
Template used for all inline messages. Whitespace between items is important.

List of variables:

- `$message` - diagnostic message text

- `$count` - Number of diagnostics on the line

- `$severity` - Severity prefix taken from `#errorLens.severityText#`

- `$source` - Source of diagnostic e.g. "eslint"

- `$code` - Code of the diagnostic

errorLens.messageMaxChars.markdownDescription: Cut off inline message if it's longer than this value.

errorLens.annotationPrefix.markdownDescription: Specify diagnostic message prefixes (when `#errorLens.addAnnotationTextPrefixes#` is enabled). For example, emoji:   .

errorLens.addAnnotationTextPrefixes.markdownDescription: When enabled - prepends diagnostic severity ('ERROR:', 'WARNING:' etc) to the message. (Prefixes can be configured with `annotationPrefix` setting).

errorLens.addNumberOfDiagnostics.markdownDescription: When enabled - prepends number of diagnostics on the line. Like: `[1/2]`.

errorLens.messageEnabled.description: Controls whether inline message is shown or not (Including background highlight).

errorLens.statusBarIconsEnabled.markdownDescription: When enabled - shows highlighted error/warning icons in status bar.

errorLens.statusBarIconsUseBackground.markdownDescription: When enabled - highlights status bar icons with background, when disabled - with foreground.

errorLens.statusBarIconsAtZero.markdownDescription: What to do when there are 0 errors/warnings - hide the item or strip its background color.

errorLens.statusBarMessageEnabled.markdownDescription: When enabled - shows message in status bar.

errorLens.statusBarColorsEnabled.markdownDescription: When enabled - use message decoration foreground as color of Status Bar text.

errorLens.statusBarMessageType.markdownDescription: Pick what to show in Status Bar: closest message or only message for the active line.
enumDescriptions: Show closest to the cursor diagnostic.
Show closest to the cursor diagnostic (sorted by severity e.g. error will be shown before warning even if it's farther from the cursor).
Show only diagnostic that is on the same line as the cursor.

errorLens.statusBarCommand.markdownDescription: Pick command that activates on click for Status Bar.

errorLens.statusBarMessageTemplate.markdownDescription: Template for status bar message. See `#errorLens.messageTemplate#`.

errorLens.exclude.description: Specify messages that should not be highlighted (RegExp).

errorLens.excludeBySource.markdownDescription: Specify sources that should not be highlighted (string). Example: `["eslint"]`

errorLens.excludePatterns.markdownDescription: Exclude files by using glob pattern. Example `["**/*.{ts,js}"]`

errorLens.light.description: Specify color of decorations for when the light color theme is active.

errorGutterIconPath.description: Absolute path to error gutter icon for light themes.

warningGutterIconPath.description: Absolute path to warning gutter icon for light themes.

infoGutterIconPath.description: Absolute path to info gutter icon for light themes.

errorGutterIconColor.markdownDescription: Error color of `circle` gutter icon set for light themes.

warningGutterIconColor.markdownDescription: Warning color of `circle` gutter icon set for light themes.

infoGutterIconColor.markdownDescription: Info color of `circle` gutter icon set for light themes.

errorLens.delay.markdownDescription: Delay (ms) before showing problem decorations (**0** to disable). Minimum delay of **500** is enforced by the extension. New errors will be added with this delay; old errors that were fixed should disappear faster.

errorLens.onSave.description: When enabled - updates decorations only on document save (manual).

errorLens.onSaveTimeout.description: Time period (ms) that used for showing decorations after the document save.

enumDescriptions: Highlight all problems in file
Highlight only the problem at the cursor
Highlight only closest to the cursor problem
errorLens.followCursor.description: Highlight only portion of the problems.

errorLens.followCursorMore.markdownDescription:
Augments `followCursor`.
Adds number of lines to top and bottom when `followCursor` is `activeLine`.
 Adds number of closest problems when `followCursor` is `closestProblem`

errorLens.gutterIconsEnabled.description: When enabled - shows gutter icons (In place of the debug breakpoint icon).

errorLens.gutterIconsFollowCursorOverrid.markdownDescription: When enabled and `#errorLens.followCursor#` setting is not `allLines`, then gutter icons would be rendered for all problems. But line decorations (background, message) only for active line.

enumDescriptions: Similar to vscode icons in Problems Panel (old).
Similar to vscode icons in Problems Panel (new).
Similar to vscode icons in Problems Panel, only without a border.
Simple filled circle.

errorLens.errorGutterIconPath.description: Absolute path to error gutter icon.

errorLens.warningGutterIconPath.description: Absolute path to warning gutter icon.

errorLens.infoGutterIconPath.description: Absolute path to info gutter icon.

errorLens.errorGutterIconColor.markdownDescription: Error color of `circle` gutter icon set.

errorLens.warningGutterIconColor.markdownDescription: Warning color of `circle` gutter icon set.

errorLens.infoGutterIconColor.markdownDescription: Info color of `circle` gutter icon set.

errorLens.removeLinebreaks.markdownDescription: When enabled - replaces line breaks in inline diagnostic message with whitespaces.

errorLens.scrollbarHackEnabled.markdownDescription: When enabled - prevents showing horizontal scrollbar in editor (caused by inline decorations).

gradle.autoDetect.description: Controls whether Gradle tasks should be automatically detected

anyOf.description: Discover specific nested projects (by directory name)

gradle.nestedProjects.description: Discover Gradle projects in nested sub-directories

enumDescriptions: Use a dedicated terminal for a specific task. The terminal is not shared with other tasks.
Create a new terminal when a task is executed.
Share the terminal with other tasks.
gradle.reuseTerminals.markdownDescription: Reuse task terminals behaviour, will be overridden to `off` if `gradle.allowParallelRun` is true.

gradle.debug.description: Show extra debug information in the output panel

gradle.disableConfirmations.description: Disable the warning confirm messages when performing batch actions

gradle.focusTaskInExplorer.description: Focus the task in the explorer when running a task

gradle.javaDebug.cleanOutput.description: Clean the task output cache before debugging

tasks.description: List of JavaExec tasks to debug

clean.description: Clean the task output cache before debugging

gradle.showStoppedDaemons.description: Show stopped daemons in the Gradle Daemons view

gradle.allowParallelRun.markdownDescription: Allow to run tasks in parallel, each running will create a new terminal. This configuration will override `gradle.reuseTerminals` and always create new task terminals when running or debugging a task.

vsicons.dontShowNewVersionMessage.description: If set to 'true', the new version message won't be shown anymore.

vsicons.dontShowConfigManuallyChangedMes.description: If set to 'true', when manually changing the configurations, the 'restart' message won't be shown.

vsicons.projectDetection.autoReload.description: If set to 'true', the extension will restart automatically on project detection.

vsicons.projectDetection.disableDetect.description: If set to 'true', the extension will disable the project detection.

vsicons.presets.angular.description: If set to 'true', the extension will match some of the common Angular patterns.

vsicons.presets.nestjs.description: If set to 'true', the extension will match some of the common NestJS patterns.

vsicons.presets.jsOfficial.description: If set to 'true', the extension will use the official JS icon.

vsicons.presets.tsOfficial.description: If set to 'true', the extension will use the official TS icon.

vsicons.presets.jsonOfficial.description: If set to 'true', the extension will use the official JSON icon.

vsicons.presets.hideFolders.description: If set to 'true', all folders will be hidden.

vsicons.presets.foldersAllDefaultIcon.description: If set to 'true', all folders will have the default folder icon.

vsicons.presets.hideExplorerArrows.description: If set to 'true', the extension will hide the folder arrows in the 'Explorer'.

vsicons.customIconFolderPath.description: The physical path to the parent folder where the custom icons folder resides on your local machine.

vsicons.associations.files.description: These custom associations will override the file icon associations defined by default.

vsicons.associations.folders.description: These custom associations will override the folder icon associations defined by default.

vsicons.associations.fileDefault.file.description: This setting will let you change the default file icon for dark themes.

vsicons.associations.fileDefault.file_li.description: This setting will let you change the default file icon for light themes.

vsicons.associations.folderDefault.folde.description: This setting will let you change the default folder icon for dark themes.

vsicons.associations.folderDefault.root_.description: This setting will let you change the default root folder icon for dark themes.

vsicons.associations.folderDefault.folde.description: This setting will let you change the default folder icon for light themes.

vsicons.associations.folderDefault.root_.description: This setting will let you change the default root folder icon for light themes.

gistpad.treeIcons.description: Specifies whether to show the gist type icons in the gists tree.

gistpad.comments.showThread.description: Specifies when to display the comment thread when you open a Gist file.

gistpad.images.directoryName.description: Specifies the name of the directory that pasted images are uploaded to.

gistpad.images.markdownPasteFormat.description: Specifies the markup format to use when pasting an image into a markdown gist file.

gistpad.images.pasteType.description: Specifies the upload method to use when pasting an image into a gist file.

gistpad.scratchNotes.directoryFormat.description: Specifies the moment.js format string to use when generating new scratch notes.

gistpad.scratchNotes.fileFormat.description: Specifies the moment.js format string to use when generating new scratch notes.

gistpad.scratchNotes.fileExtension.description: Specifies the file extension to use when generating new scratch notes.

gistpad.scratchNotes.show.description: Specifies whether or not to display the scratch notes node in the gists tree view.

gistpad.showcaseUrl.description: Specifies the URL of the showcase to display gists from.

gistpad.wikis.daily.directoryName.description: Specifies the name of the directory that daily pages are organized within.

gistpad.wikis.daily.titleFormat.description: Specifies the date format (using Moment.js syntax) that is used to for the title of daily pages.

markdown.extension.completion.respectVsc.markdownDescription: Whether to exclude files from auto-completion using VS Code's `#search.exclude#` setting. (`node_modules`, `bower_components` and `*.code-search` are **always excluded**, not affected by this option.)

markdown.extension.completion.root.description: The root folder for path auto-completion.

markdown.extension.italic.indicator.markdownDescription: Use `*` or `_` to wrap italic text.

markdownEnumDescriptions:
Adaptive indentation size according to the context, trying to **left align the sublist with its parent's content**. For example:

```markdown
- Parent
  - Sublist

1. Parent
   1. Sublist

10. Parent with longer marker
    1. Sublist
```

Use the configured tab size of the current document (see the status bar). For example (with `tabSize: 4`):

```markdown
- Parent
    - Sublist

1. Parent
    1. Sublist

10. Parent with longer marker
    1. Sublist
```
markdown.extension.list.indentationSize.markdownDescription:
List indentation scheme. (Also affects TOC generation.)

Whether to use different indentation sizes on different list contexts or stick to VS Code's tab size.

markdown.extension.math.enabled.description: Enable basic math support (Powered by KaTeX).

markdownEnumDescriptions: Always use `1.` as ordered list marker.
Use increasing numbers as ordered list marker.

markdown.extension.print.absoluteImgPath.description: Convert image path to absolute path.

markdown.extension.print.imgToBase64.description: Convert images to base64 when printing to HTML.

markdown.extension.print.includeVscodeSt.description: Include VS Code's basic Markdown styles so that the exported HTML looks similar as inside VS Code.

markdown.extension.print.onFileSave.description: Print current document to HTML when file is saved.

markdown.extension.print.theme.description: Theme of the exported HTML. Only affects code blocks.

markdown.extension.syntax.decorations.description: Add syntax decorations in editors. (e.g. ~~strikethrough~~, `code span`)

markdown.extension.syntax.decorationFile.description: If a file is larger than this size (in byte/B), we won't attempt to render syntax decorations.

markdown.extension.syntax.plainTheme.markdownDescription:
(**Experimental**) Report issue at <https://github.com/yzhang-gh/vscode-markdown/issues/185>.

Only take effect when `#markdown.extension.syntax.decorations#` is enabled.

markdown.extension.tableFormatter.normal.markdownDescription: Normalize table indentation to closest multiple of configured editor tab size.

markdown.extension.toc.downcaseLink.markdownDescription: Whether to **force** to downcase TOC links.

markdown.extension.toc.levels.markdownDescription: Range of levels for table of contents. Use `x..y` for level `x` to `y`.

markdown.extension.toc.plaintext.description: Just plain text TOC, no links.

markdown.extension.toc.slugifyMode.markdownDescription: The method to generate heading ID. This affects **links to headings** in **TOC**, **code completion**, and **printing**.
enumDescriptions: GitHub
Azure DevOps
Gitea
GitLab
Visual Studio Code

markdown.extension.toc.unorderedList.mar.markdownDescription: Use `-`, `*`, or `+` in the table of contents (for **unordered** list).

vscode-theme-studio.browser-colors-panel.description: Opens the browser colors panel after update.

workbench.editor.autoLockGroups.description: If an editor matching one of the listed types is opened as the first in an editor group and more than one group is open, the group is automatically locked. Locked groups will only be used for opening editors when explicitly chosen by user gesture (e.g. drag and drop), but not by default. Consequently the active editor in a locked group is less likely to be replaced accidentally with a different editor.

workbench.welcomePage.preferReducedMotio.description: When enabled, reduce motion in welcome page.

terminal.integrated.defaultProfile.linux.markdownDescription: The default profile used on Linux. This setting will currently be ignored if either `terminal.integrated.shell.linux` or `terminal.integrated.shellArgs.linux` are set.

terminal.integrated.defaultProfile.osx.markdownDescription: The default profile used on macOS. This setting will currently be ignored if either `terminal.integrated.shell.osx` or `terminal.integrated.shellArgs.osx` are set.

terminal.integrated.defaultProfile.windo.markdownDescription: The default profile used on Windows. This setting will currently be ignored if either `terminal.integrated.shell.windows` or `terminal.integrated.shellArgs.windows` are set.
markdownEnumDescriptions:
$(terminal) Git Bash
- path: C:\Program Files\Git\bin\bash.exe
- args: ['--login']
